dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: I don't suppose you've found the targeting module yet. I've sent patrols, but they're running into trouble with the Iconoclasts.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Could you agree to a truce with the Iconoclasts?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Why do you need the targeting module?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'll let you know when I've made progress.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: They're all mad! And what's more, they left us. I don't see any way for us to work together.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I've read your reviews, Sanjar. You can't do this alone.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Forget I said anything.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: This has been my albatross. The great shame of my career.

dialog.speaker: Celia (Female)
dialog.utterance: Remember what we practiced, sir.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: Yes. The words in those reviews were very hurtful, but they do not define me. I am a mantipillar, and my will is my cocoon. I can emerge and become whatever I wish.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You're good with details, but you could use someone who sees the big picture.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: The people who wrote your reviews are the same type of people you'll deal with on the Board.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Pull your head out of your ass, Sanjar. Don't screw this opportunity up over your wounded pride.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: You, too?!

dialog.speaker: Celia (Female)
dialog.utterance: He has a point, sir. And it's not all bad.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: Supposing you're right, who exactly would you have me work with? The Iconoclasts are not the most compromising sorts.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: How did things get so bad between you and the Iconoclasts?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: What about Graham's second-in-command, Zora?

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: How do these things ever start? Once upon a time, Graham and I saw the same problems with MSI - a rigid corporate structure with no regard for its people.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: But where I wanted to reform MSI, he only wanted to take it apart. As if starving in the wilderness is somehow better than starving under corporate mismanagement.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: He won't hear reason now. And I wouldn't trust him again.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: That's an interesting suggestion. I confess, I don't know much about her except that she worked for Rizzo.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: I'd be willing to consider it. But I'd need to see her review first.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: <Give him Zora's review.> Actually, I already found it on a terminal in Cascadia.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Are you serious?

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: Very well. I can't promise anything, but let's see what we have here.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: Well, it seems like she... she's actually very qualified.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: I wasn't expecting to say this, but if you can put her in charge and convince her to agree to a meeting, I'd be willing to discuss terms.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Very well.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: One can't be haphazard about these things!

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: Besides, if you think her skills will complement mine, then we should see what those skills are.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: I hadn't thought of it that way. Perhaps you have a point.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: Normally, I'd find this kind of talk from you quite invigorating. But this is a difficult moment for me.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: Still, perhaps you have a point.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: Nonsense! I value original thought. That's what makes MSI different, after all.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: Well, because the module controls the weapons systems.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I mean, why do you need the gunship's weapons systems?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Seems like your people should be able to handle this.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: What's so bad about the Iconoclasts reaching the gunship?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Enough about the gunship.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: Because once we mount them on Stellar Bay's walls, no marauder or raptidon will ever be a threat to us again.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: Stellar Bay will be as secure as any other settlement in Halcyon.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: If you say so.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: That's a worthy goal.

dialog.speaker: Celia (Female)
dialog.utterance: The point is, this weapons system would be a powerful advantage. And we can't risk the Iconoclasts getting it.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: Look, Celia, he's being funny again.

dialog.speaker: Celia (Female)
dialog.utterance: I don't think so, sir.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: Really? I could have sworn- well, that's not important.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: What is important is that there's a considerable distance between us and that ship, and most of it is inhabited by marauders and raptidons.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Yeah, that's pretty treacherous.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: What's the matter? Can't get your hands dirty now and then?

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: It is. And that's not saying anything about the sulfur pits, the mantisaurs, the Iconoclast rebels...

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: Celia, do we have any Pep Pills? I'm feeling light-headed.

dialog.speaker: Celia (Female)
dialog.utterance: I'm afraid you finished them going over the sales reports last week.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: Well, I suppose you see our predicament.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: Do you just think of these things in the moment, or do you write them down and save them for later? They're very good.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Just answer the question.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Forget I asked.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: Oh, I can play along.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: What I've got here is a town full of yellow-bellied corporate castoffs who wouldn't know a stun baton from a slide rule!

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: How was that?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Pretty good, actually.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Needs improvement.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: Wow, thanks, I... thank you.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: I can work on it.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: Oh. Okay.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: Can you imagine what those maniacs would do with weapons like that? They'd wreak havoc.

dialog.speaker: Celia (Female)
dialog.utterance: And roll back all the progress we've made at reconciling with the rest of Halcyon.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Good point.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You don't know that.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Maybe things need a shake-up.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: Even if they merely sat on the scraps, the threat of a bunch of anarchists holding a gunship would bring the full wrath of the Board down on Monarch. We can't afford that.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: Oh, I've known their ilk long enough.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: This would be more than a shake-up.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: Good, because we haven't a moment to lose.
